TopicTitle: Kopernicus Lagrange Points?? Is it possible?

Articles.Content: Title says it all.. i want to know if its possible to make Lagrange Points with Kopernicus, maybe by making a "planet" that has 0 colliders and no textures... idk... all the help would be great
I don't think Kopernicus lets you break physics by letting you create an object that has the wrong orbital speed for its SMA, I'm afraid... You could model L3 and L4 this way, but not the others.
A mod called Principia replaces the stock orbital physics with fully realistic N-body orbital physics, so you might want to take a look at that

I could be wrong but I don't believe you'll be able to get Lagrange points without resorting to Principia as mentioned above. You might be able to make a mod (dll type mod) to give you the same effect but I haven't seen the idea mentioned much less implemented - may be some difficulties involved as there seems to be a constant interest in the idea of Lagrange points.
